intro: Commelina aethiopica, commonly known as the African spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers with three petals and three sepals, often accompanied by two white or pale green bracts. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Commelina aethiopica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along streambanks.
